title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When opening an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets', and marking the file as dirty by adding a space character at the end of the first line, performing the 'Revert' action from the pop-up menu in the editor takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The 'Revert' action in the editor should take a similar amount of time as closing the editor tab, answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, and double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
SR:
1) Open the 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' file from the 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' source folder in the 'org.eclipse.swt' project. 
2) Add a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty. 
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and select 'no' when prompted to save changes. 
4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 
5) Compare the time taken for these steps with the time taken to perform the 'Revert' action from the pop-up menu in the editor.
